traits.smithy.api#documentation: The type of navigation action. Valid values are url and anchor. This value is required for a navigation action.
The URL to the location to open. Specify this value for a navigation action.
The HTML anchor link to the location to open. Specify this value for a navigation action.
The element within the same component to modify when the action occurs.
Specifies whether the user should be signed out globally. Specify this value for an auth sign out action.
The name of the data model. Use when the action performs an operation on an Amplify DataStore model.
The unique ID of the component that the ActionParameters apply to.
A dictionary of key-value pairs mapping Amplify Studio properties to fields in a data model. Use when the action performs an operation on an Amplify DataStore model.
A key-value pair that specifies the state property name and its initial value.

Represents the event action configuration for an element of a Component or ComponentChild. Use for the workflow feature in Amplify Studio that allows you to bind events and actions to components. ActionParameters defines the action that is performed when an event occurs on the component.

aws:ResourceTag/${TagKey}.documentation: Filters access based on the tags associated with the resource

aws:RequestTag/${TagKey}.documentation: Filters access based on the tags that are passed in the request

aws:TagKeys.documentation: Filters access based on the tag keys that are passed in the request

traits.smithy.api#documentation:
The Amplify UI Builder API provides a programmatic interface for creating and configuring user interface (UI) component libraries and themes for use in your Amplify applications. You can then connect these UI components to an application's backend Amazon Web Services resources.

You can also use the Amplify Studio visual designer to create UI components and model data for an app. For more information, see Introduction in the Amplify Docs.

The Amplify Framework is a comprehensive set of SDKs, libraries, tools, and documentation for client app development. For more information, see the Amplify Framework. For more information about deploying an Amplify application to Amazon Web Services, see the Amplify User Guide.
The unique ID of the Amplify app associated with the component.
The name of the backend environment that is a part of the Amplify app.
The unique ID of the component in its original source system, such as Figma.
The unique ID of the component.
The name of the component.
The type of the component. This can be an Amplify custom UI component or another custom component.
Describes the component's properties. You can't specify tags as a valid property for properties.
A list of the component's ComponentChild instances.
A list of the component's variants. A variant is a unique style configuration of a main component.
Describes the component's properties that can be overriden in a customized instance of the component. You can't specify tags as a valid property for overrides.
The information to connect a component's properties to data at runtime. You can't specify tags as a valid property for bindingProperties.
The data binding configuration for the component's properties. Use this for a collection component. You can't specify tags as a valid property for collectionProperties.
The time that the component was created.
The time that the component was modified.
One or more key-value pairs to use when tagging the component.
Describes the events that can be raised on the component. Use for the workflow feature in Amplify Studio that allows you to bind events and actions to components.
The schema version of the component when it was imported.

Contains the configuration settings for a user interface (UI) element for an Amplify app. A component is configured as a primary, stand-alone UI element. Use ComponentChild to configure an instance of a Component. A ComponentChild instance inherits the configuration of the main Component.
The property type.
Describes the properties to customize with data at runtime.
The default value of the property.

Represents the data binding configuration for a component at runtime. You can use ComponentBindingPropertiesValue to add exposed properties to a component to allow different values to be entered when a component is reused in different places in an app.
An Amplify DataStore model.
The field to bind the data to.
A list of predicates for binding a component's properties to data.
An authenticated user attribute.
An Amazon S3 bucket.
The storage key for an Amazon S3 bucket.
The default value to assign to the property.

Represents the data binding configuration for a specific property using data stored in Amazon Web Services. For Amazon Web Services connected properties, you can bind a property to data stored in an Amazon S3 bucket, an Amplify DataStore model or an authenticated user attribute.
The type of the child component.
The name of the child component.
Describes the properties of the child component. You can't specify tags as a valid property for properties.
The list of ComponentChild instances for this component.
Describes the events that can be raised on the child component. Use for the workflow feature in Amplify Studio that allows you to bind events and actions to components.
The unique ID of the child component in its original source system, such as Figma.
A nested UI configuration within a parent Component.
The name of the conditional property.
The name of a field. Specify this when the property is a data model.
The operator to use to perform the evaluation, such as eq to represent equals.
The value of the property to evaluate.
The value to assign to the property if the condition is met.
The value to assign to the property if the condition is not met.
The type of the property to evaluate.
Represents a conditional expression to set a component property. Use ComponentConditionProperty to set a property to different values conditionally, based on the value of another property.
The name of the data model to use to bind data to a component.
Describes how to sort the component's properties.
Represents the conditional logic to use when binding data to a component. Use this property to retrieve only a subset of the data in a collection.
A list of IDs to use to bind data to a component. Use this property to bind specifically chosen data, rather than data retrieved from a query.
Describes the configuration for binding a component's properties to data.
The action to perform when a specific event is raised.
Describes information about the action.
Binds an event to an action on a component. When you specify a bindingEvent, the event is called when the action is performed.
Describes the configuration of an event. You can bind an event and a corresponding action to a Component or a ComponentChild. A button click is an example of an event.
The value to assign to the component property.
The information to bind the component property to data at runtime.
The information to bind the component property to data at runtime. Use this for collection components.
The default value to assign to the component property.
The data model to use to assign a value to the component property.
The information to bind the component property to form data.
An event that occurs in your app. Use this for workflow data binding.
An authenticated user attribute to use to assign a value to the component property.
A list of component properties to concatenate to create the value to assign to this component property.
The conditional expression to use to assign a value to the component property.
Specifies whether the user configured the property in Amplify Studio after importing it.
The component type.
The default value assigned to the property when the component is imported into an app.
The name of the component that is affected by an event.
The name of the component's property that is affected by an event.
Describes the configuration for all of a component's properties. Use ComponentProperty to specify the values to render or bind by default.
The component property to bind to the data field.
The data field to bind the property to.
Associates a component property to a binding property. This enables exposed properties on the top level component to propagate data to the component's property values.
The unique ID of the Amplify app associated with the component.
The name of the backend environment that is a part of the Amplify app.
The unique ID of the component.
The name of the component.
The component type.
Contains a summary of a component. This is a read-only data type that is returned by ListComponents.
The combination of variants that comprise this variant. You can't specify tags as a valid property for variantValues.
The properties of the component variant that can be overriden when customizing an instance of the component. You can't specify tags as a valid property for overrides.
Describes the style configuration of a unique variation of a main component.
Creates a new component for an Amplify app.
The name of the component
The unique ID of the component in its original source system, such as Figma.
The component type. This can be an Amplify custom UI component or another custom component.
Describes the component's properties.
A list of child components that are instances of the main component.
A list of the unique variants of this component.
Describes the component properties that can be overriden to customize an instance of the component.
The data binding information for the component's properties.
The data binding configuration for customizing a component's properties. Use this for a collection component.
One or more key-value pairs to use when tagging the component data.
The event configuration for the component. Use for the workflow feature in Amplify Studio that allows you to bind events and actions to components.
The schema version of the component when it was imported.
Represents all of the information that is required to create a component.
The unique ID of the Amplify app to associate with the component.
The name of the backend environment that is a part of the Amplify app.
The unique client token.
Represents the configuration of the component to create.
Describes the configuration of the new component.
Creates a theme to apply to the components in an Amplify app.
The name of the theme.
A list of key-value pairs that deÔ¨Ånes the properties of the theme.
Describes the properties that can be overriden to customize an instance of the theme.
One or more key-value pairs to use when tagging the theme data.
Represents all of the information that is required to create a theme.
The unique ID of the Amplify app associated with the theme.
The name of the backend environment that is a part of the Amplify app.
The unique client token.
Represents the configuration of the theme to create.
Describes the configuration of the new theme.
Deletes a component from an Amplify app.
The unique ID of the Amplify app associated with the component to delete.
The name of the backend environment that is a part of the Amplify app.
The unique ID of the component to delete.
Deletes a theme from an Amplify app.
The unique ID of the Amplify app associated with the theme to delete.
The name of the backend environment that is a part of the Amplify app.
The unique ID of the theme to delete.
Exchanges an access code for a token.
The third-party provider for the token. The only valid value is figma.
Describes the configuration of the request.
The access code to send in the request.
The location of the application that will receive the access code.
Describes the configuration of a request to exchange an access code for a token.
The access token.
The date and time when the new access token expires.
The token to use to refresh a previously issued access token that might have expired.
Exports component configurations to code that is ready to integrate into an Amplify app.
The unique ID of the Amplify app to export components to.
The name of the backend environment that is a part of the Amplify app.
The token to request the next page of results.
Represents the configuration of the exported components.
The pagination token that's included if more results are available.
Exports theme configurations to code that is ready to integrate into an Amplify app.
The unique ID of the Amplify app to export the themes to.
The name of the backend environment that is part of the Amplify app.
The token to request the next page of results.
Represents the configuration of the exported themes.
The pagination token that's included if more results are available.
The name of the component to retrieve a value from.
The property to retrieve a value from.
Describes how to bind a component property to form data.
Returns an existing component for an Amplify app.
The unique ID of the Amplify app.
The name of the backend environment that is part of the Amplify app.
The unique ID of the component.
Represents the configuration settings for the component.
Returns an existing theme for an Amplify app.
The unique ID of the Amplify app.
The name of the backend environment that is part of the Amplify app.
The unique ID for the theme.
Represents the configuration settings for the theme.
An internal error has occurred. Please retry your request.
An invalid or out-of-range value was supplied for the input parameter.
Retrieves a list of components for a specified Amplify app and backend environment.
The unique ID for the Amplify app.
The name of the backend environment that is a part of the Amplify app.
The token to request the next page of results.
The maximum number of components to retrieve.
The list of components for the Amplify app.
The pagination token that's included if more results are available.
Retrieves a list of themes for a specified Amplify app and backend environment.

The name of the backend environment that is a part of the Amplify app.

The list of themes for the Amplify app.
The pagination token that's returned if more results are available.
The name of the component that is being modified.
The name of the component property to apply the state configuration to.
The state configuration to assign to the property.
Represents the state configuration when an action modifies a property of another element within the same component.
A list of predicates to combine logically.
A list of predicates to combine logically.
The field to query.
The operator to use to perform the evaluation.
The value to use when performing the evaluation.
Stores information for generating Amplify DataStore queries. Use a Predicate to retrieve a subset of the data in a collection.
Refreshes a previously issued access token that might have expired.
The third-party provider for the token. The only valid value is figma.
Information about the refresh token request.
The token to use to refresh a previously issued access token that might have expired.

The access token.

The resource specified in the request conflicts with an existing resource.
The requested resource does not exist, or access was denied.
You exceeded your service quota. Service quotas, also referred to as limits, are the maximum number of service resources or operations for your Amazon Web Services account.
The field to perform the sort on.
The direction of the sort, either ascending or descending.
Describes how to sort the data that you bind to a component.
The unique ID for the Amplify app associated with the theme.
The name of the backend environment that is a part of the Amplify app.
